info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 08 at 11:10AM PST until December 08 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT... -For the Winter Weather Advisory, Snow expected, with accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph will result in reduced visibilities due to blowing snow. * WHERE...Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades. The advisory covers mostly remote backcountry areas in the Siskiyous from Mt. Ashland west, and also north of highway 140. Both the advisory and watch include Mt. Ashland and some portion of the road leading up there. The Watch also includes Siskiyou summit & Interstate 5, Howard Prairie, highways 140 and 66. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 10 AM this morning to 10 PM PST this evening. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Friday afternoon through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snowfall during the Winter Storm Watch period is expected after 10 PM PST. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com or http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
